data.title: VSCode can't find binaries in my path (jshint)
data.body:
From: #17282

- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Archlinux

Hi,

I have some binaries such as eslint, jshint or tslint in a user defined binary directory (`/home/user/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/.bin/`).
This directly is added to the `PATH` at session startup and is visible to vscode.
I checked in the `/proc/pid/environ` file of my running vscode (actually I checked the process that run the jshint server as well as the one for the workspace) that it has the PATH environment variable correctly set.

Still, when I open a `.js` file, I get the following message:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/160975/21218484/1ff5b948-c2b1-11e6-8a80-b84be1f166c9.png)

It is the same for eslint:
```
[Info  - 10:21:51] ESLint server is running.
[Info  - 10:21:51] 
Failed to load the ESLint library for the document /home/vnoel/Linagora/Petals/dev/git/petals-cockpit-new/frontend/generate-headers.js

To use ESLint in this workspace please install eslint using 'npm install eslint' or globally using 'npm install -g eslint'.
You need to reopen the workspace after installing eslint.
```

Surprisingly I don't have the problem with tslint even though it is in the same pathâ€¦

data.title: SCSS validation inside html <style> tags
data.body:
Recently, css validation has been added to html style tags, which is a cool feature, especially for Vue.js developers (that use .vue single file components).

But most Vue.js developers use css preprocessor inside their .vue files, using for example <style lang="scss"> tags.

Unfortunately, as far as I know, only css validation is supported inside <style> tags, resulting in many unnecessary errors.

Is there any workaround to this? If not, it would be nice to have this.
Either support "lang" attribute inside <style> tags or let us change <style> language type globally.

Thanks! 
PS.: Since Vue.js is getting more and more popular, I think it would be nice to have more Vue.js integrations with VS code in general, similar to React or Angular.

data.title: "editor.referenceInfos" setting marked as "Unknown configuration setting"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 x86-64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open `settings.json`.
2. Place next option inside it.
```json
"editor.referenceInfos": false
```
3. Save `settings.json`.

Actual Results:
- It will be squiggled with the tooltip "Unknown configuration setting".
![referenceinfos](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15720243/21285596/0ea1b8ce-c44e-11e6-8ea1-411a82381011.gif)

Expected Results:
- No squiggles and tooltip have to be shown.
- `editor.referenceInfos` setting should be known.

data.title: Debug Console window cannot accept Console.ReadLine() input during debugging
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Win10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Create a new .net core cli app using "dotnet new"
2.  Open the folder using VS code
3. Add two lines of code in Program.cs
   string a = Console.ReadLine();
   Console.WriteLine(a);
4. Switch to VS code debug window and start debugging
5. Debug Console window shows, and displays the first "Hello, World." output, and stops on the line of Console.ReadLine(), enter anything in the Debug Console and press Enter will be given err message of "Unable to perform this action because the process is running."
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20870130/21284333/5bc5122c-c453-11e6-9419-575b74520d3b.png)

data.title: [VS Code 1.8][Breaking change] contentChanges of TextDocumentChangeEvent returns wrong text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 - OS Version: All OS Several Auto Close Tag users [complain](https://github.com/formulahendry/vscode-auto-close-tag/issues/19) about the extension not working after they upgrade to VS Code 1.8 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install [Auto Close Tag](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.auto-close-tag) 2. Open a html file, and type a open tag, e.g. `
` Expected: A close tag `
` is appended Actual: Nothing happens After investigation, this issue only happens in a html file and the contentChanges of TextDocumentChangeEvent returns wrong text in https://github.com/formulahendry/vscode-auto-close-tag/blob/master/src/extension.ts#L21 When you type `>` after ``, while it return the text of whole line: `
` Since a lot of users are using this function and the impact for user is big, I am wondering if we have any other workaround to use this API, or could we fix this in 1.8.1?

data.title: Sort order for file quickopen should prefer shorter paths
data.body:
I love VSCode, but the sort order for quickopen doesn't work all that well sometimes...

For example, shorter files within longer paths should not trump over shorter paths with a longer filename, especially if the search string includes a path separator

- VSCode Version: 1.8
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file named `config/test.js`
2. Create a subfolder named `config/test`
3. Create the files `config/test/t1.js` and `config/test/t2.js`
4. Use quick open and type `co/te`

Expected first result: `config/test.js`
Actual first result: `confing/test/t1.js`. `config/test.js` comes only after t2

data.title: SQL Linter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: feature request (future)
- OS Version: n/a

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a valid .SQL file
2. No linting or hinting appears for syntax errors or formatting issues

Full request details:

I'd like to have a custom linter and formatter for the SQL language - similar to what is available for the python language via plugin support. I found sample code for a simple formatter [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/blogs/2016/11/15/formatters-best-practices), but the approach has two limitations: (1) the editing is somewhat "brute force" and does not use any standard grammar, and (2) there is no way in that approach to surface linting tips or syntax issues via underlining ("squigglies").

Is support for SQL coming in the near future, and/or are there any frameworks that could be used to apply grammars/rules without rewriting the core parsing/linting engine from scratch? I'm willing and able to contribute code, but I couldn't find any sample linting projects in the docs and it seems prohibitively error prone and time consuming to completely build this functionality from scratch.

data.title: Open Recent yields Save prompt with Hot Exit enabled
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Win10 version 1611

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable Hot Exit. (on by default)  Make changes in an editor, donâ€™t save, and close VS Code, it closes with no Save prompt.  Restart Code and thereâ€™s the editor with unsaved changes.  So far, so good.
2. Now, when you have unsaved changes, use ctrl-R to switch to a recent editor. Save changes prompt appears. 

Expected: switches with no save prompt, caching the modified file (same as exiting VS Code)

data.title: Feature request: preLaunchTask shouldn't be triggered when restarting debug.

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
**VSCode Version: 1.8.0**

Can't tell how each and every person uses the debug launch configuration, but I guess that many of us use it to setup the debugging environment.

## Use case

In my case, I simply use `preLaunchTask` to transpile my TS files.

As you debug, you sometimes simply need to modify the breakpoints, or you just want to restart because you stepped over something you realise you should have stepped into.

## Problem

The issue is, that every time you restart the debug session, `preLaunchTask` is executed and takes some time although the code hasn't changed.

----

I assume that when people want to change the code, they:

- Stop the debugging session
- Modify the code
- Start the session again.

I may be wrong and some people would prefer the current behaviour, in which case it would be nice to add an option to choose whether or not to trigger the `preLaunchTask`.

data.title: Add CompletionItemKind.Folder
data.body:
Fixes #17435

Adds a new completion item kind for folder/directories. This is useful for path intellisense


![screen shot 2016-12-16 at 3 57 46 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/21282363/2b319478-c3a9-11e6-9b66-21d451f7a097.png)

For the icons, I copied the icons for folders into the suggestion icon set. Let me know if new ones are needed instead.

data.title: Add `CompletionItemKind.Directory`
data.body:
For PR #17434

For path completion in TS and JS, we would like to be able to distinguish between completions for files and directories. Currently only `CompletionItemKind.File` exists, and none of the other CompletionItemKinds seem appropriate for directories.
